<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// R600 has &quot;custom&quot; lowering for truncating stores despite not supporting</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// those instructions. If we allow that custom lowering in the DAG combiner</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// then all truncates are merged into truncating stores, giving worse code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// generation. This hook prevents the DAG combiner performing that combine.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a45bf10d83a054f10b0e07ae9a0b6f80b">isTruncStoreLegal</a>(ValVT, MemVT);</span></CodeLine>
